content:
Summarized outline:

1. SEC. 13: Relationship to Other Laws
a) General relationship to other laws
b) Relationship to Section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950
i) Exercise of authority under section 721
ii) Limitations on the President's authority
iii) Coordination with the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States
c) Limitation of Authority of the Secretary

Summary of text: Section 13 establishes the relationship between this Act and other laws. It states that, except as expressly provided, nothing in the Act alters or affects any other authority, process, regulation, investigation, enforcement measure, or review provided by any other provision of federal law, or any other authority of the President or Congress. The Act does not prevent or preclude the President or the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States from exercising any authority under section 721 of the Defense Production Act of 1950. The Secretary is required to address coordination with respect to review by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States. The Secretary's authority is limited and cannot initiate a review of any transaction involving the acquisition of an information and communications technology product or service by a United States person as a party to a transaction authorized under a US government-industrial security program or to meet an articulable national security or law enforcement requirement.
